description.summary: communicate corner radius of layer surfaces

protocol.description:
This protocol provides a way for clients to communicate the corner radius of their layer shell surfaces, should they use rounded corners.
This hint can then be used by the compositor to draw fitting blur outlines or prevent overdrawing of other server-side drawn interfaces.

interface.name: layer_corner_radius_manager_v1

description.summary: corner radius manager for layer surfaces

interface.description: Manager for creating corner-radius objects for surfaces. This is designed for layer shell surfaces but works with any wl_surface.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Informs the server that the client will no longer use this global. Any previously created corner-radius objects remain valid until destroyed.

request.name: get_corner_radius

description.summary: Create a new corner-radius object for a surface

request.description:
Instantiate an interface extension for the given wl_surface to specify corner radius.
If the given wl_surface already has a layer_corner_radius_surface_v1 object associated, the corner_radius_exists protocol error will be raised.

entry.name: corner_radius_exists
entry.summary: the surface already has a corner-radius object

interface.name: layer_corner_radius_surface_v1
interface.description:
The corner-radius object provides a way to specify a corner-radius for its associated surface.
If the wl_surface associated with the layer_corner_radius_surface_v1 object has been destroyed, this object becomes inert. Any further requests other than destroy will raise the surface_destroyed protocol error.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Informs the server that the client will no longer be using this protocol object. The corner radius will be unset on the next commit.

request.name: set_radius
request.description:
This request sets the hinted corner radius values for the surface.
The corner radius hint is double-buffered state and will be applied on the next wl_surface.commit.
The value is given in logical space relative to the surface geometry.

request.name: unset_radius
request.description: Unsets any previously hinted corner radius values without invalidating the object for later use. Can be used by clients that possibly have temporary irregular shapes.

entry.name: surface_destroyed
entry.summary: the associated surface object has been already destroyed
